content: On July 15, 1982, the Atlanta Braves played a pivotal game against the Philadelphia Phillies that would lead to a memorable moment in the franchise's history. The Braves, led by pitcher Phil Niekro, won the game 8-3, which helped them to a significant 11-game winning streak during that season. This surge contributed to the Braves clinching the National League West title later that year, marking a triumphant return to the postseason after a lengthy absence.
